attributes.action: News emphasis on justice. Never reveal the private life of any human. (2 things)
attributes.additional_details: Like Imam Ali (peace be upon him) had said, "Man is either your brother in faith or your equal in humanity." and know that crime is more effectively tackled by targeting the morals of human beings within a society as opposed to i.e. increasing police force. This can be done by making a school policy for every child at a certain age to be taught the philosophy of morals. i.e The one that benefits from charity is not the deprived but the generous. Materialistic love disappears. Focus on the "why?"
attributes.background: BBC is not controlled by the government but the issue I am referring to is a matter of justice which the government IS responsible for. Much news emphasis is put on things which are not so important such as celebrity deaths or texts between partners. 2 things for all humans, privacy and justice.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about privacy and news reporting, but we're not sure what action you'd like to see. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
